member.name: T:Aspose.Page.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.License.Embedded
member.summary: License number was added as embedded resource.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:

ms.p: 2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

java.p: 2. The folder of the component jar file.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")
the component jar file:
License license = new License(); license.setLicense("MyLicense.lic"); Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.EPS.Device.PsSaveFormat
member.summary: This enumeration contains available options of saving format. It can be PS or EPS. EPS is used for only 1-paged documents while PS file can contain any number of pages.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.EPS.Device.PsSaveFormat.PS
member.summary: This option indicates that resulting document must be PostScript (PS) or Encapsulated PostScript (EPS) file.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.EPS.Device.PsSaveFormat.EPS
member.summary: This option indicates that resulting document must be Encapsulated PostScript (EPS) file. It is used only for 1-paged documents;

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.EPS.PsDocument.Save(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves given as EPS file. This method is used only after updating XMP metadata. It saves initial EPS file with updated existing metadata or new one created while calling GetMetadata method. In the last case all necessary PostScript code and EPS comments are added.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.EPS.PsDocument.Save
member.summary: Saves given as EPS file. This method is used only when PsDocument was created from scratch.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.EPS.PsDocument.GetXmpMetadata
member.summary: Reads PS/EPS file and extracts XmpMetdata if it already exists or add new one if it doesn't exist.
member.returns: Existing or new instance of XMP metadata.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.EPS.PsDocument.ExtractEpsSize
member.summary: Reads EPS file and extracts a size of EPS image from %%BoundingBox comment or default page size (595, 842) if it doesn't exist.
member.returns: The size of the EPS image.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.EPS.PsDocument.ResizeEps(System.IO.Stream,Aspose.Page.Drawing.SizeF,Aspose.Page.Units)
member.summary: Resizes given as EPS file. This method is used only after extracting EPS size. It saves initial EPS file with updated existing %%BoundingBox or new one will be created. Page transformation matrix also will be set.
member.param: New size of EPS image in assigned units.
The units of the new size. Can be points, inches, millimeters, centimeters and percents of initial size.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.EPS.PsDocument.ExtractEpsBoundingBox
member.summary: Reads EPS file and extracts bounding box of EPS image from %%BoundingBox comment or bounds for default page size (0, 0, 595, 842) if it doesn't exist.
member.returns: The bounding box of the EPS image.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.EPS.PsDocument.CropEps(System.IO.Stream,System.Single[])
member.summary: Crops given as EPS file. It saves initial EPS file with updated existing %%BoundingBox or new one will be created.
member.param: The crop box (x0, y0, x, y).

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Color.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a structure from the four ARGB component (alpha, red, green, and blue) values. Although this method allows a 32-bit value to be passed for each component, the value of each component is limited to 8 bits.
member.param: The alpha component. Valid values are 0 through 255.
The red component. Valid values are 0 through 255.
The green component. Valid values are 0 through 255.
The blue component. Valid values are 0 through 255.
member.exception: , , , or is less than 0 or greater than 255.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Color.FromArgb(System.Int32,Aspose.Page.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Creates a structure from the specified structure, but with the new specified alpha value. Although this method allows a 32-bit value to be passed for the alpha value, the value is limited to 8 bits.
member.param: The alpha value for the new . Valid values are 0 through 255.
The from which to create the new .
member.exception: is less than 0 or greater than 255.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Color.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a structure from the specified 8-bit color values (red, green, and blue). The alpha value is implicitly 255 (fully opaque). Although this method allows a 32-bit value to be passed for each color component, the value of each component is limited to 8 bits.
member.param: The red component value for the new . Valid values are 0 through 255.
The green component value for the new . Valid values are 0 through 255.
The blue component value for the new . Valid values are 0 through 255.
member.exception: , , or is less than 0 or greater than 255.

member.summary: Creates a structure from the specified name of a predefined color.
member.param: A string that is the name of a predefined color. Valid names are the same as the names of the elements of the enumeration.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Color.GetBrightness
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) brightness value for this structure.
member.returns: The brightness of this . The brightness ranges from 0.0 through 1.0, where 0.0 represents black and 1.0 represents white.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Color.GetHue
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) hue value, in degrees, for this structure.
member.returns: The hue, in degrees, of this . The hue is measured in degrees, ranging from 0.0 through 360.0, in HSB color space.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Color.GetSaturation
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) saturation value for this structure.
member.returns: The saturation of this . The saturation ranges from 0.0 through 1.0, where 0.0 is grayscale and 1.0 is the most saturated.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Drawing2D.GraphicsPath.CloseFigure

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Drawing2D.GraphicsPath.CloseAllFigures
member.summary: Closes all open figures in this path and starts a new figure. It closes each open figure by connecting a line from its endpoint to its starting point.

member.summary: Specifies high-quality, bicubic interpolation. Prefiltering is performed to ensure high-quality shrinking. This mode produces the highest quality transformed images.

A enumeration element that specifies the orientation of the gradient. The orientation determines the starting and ending points of the gradient. For example, LinearGradientMode.ForwardDiagonal specifies that the starting point is the upper-left corner of the rectangle and the ending point is the lower-right corner of the rectangle.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint
member.summary: Specifies the quality of text rendering.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint.SystemDefault
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph bitmap, with the system default rendering hint. The text will be drawn using whatever font-smoothing settings the user has selected for the system.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint.SingleBitPerPixelGridFit
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph bitmap. Hinting is used to improve character appearance on stems and curvature.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint.SingleBitPerPixel
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph bitmap. Hinting is not used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint.AntiAliasGridFit
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its antialiased glyph bitmap with hinting. Much better quality due to antialiasing, but at a higher performance cost.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint.AntiAlias
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its antialiased glyph bitmap without hinting. Better quality due to antialiasing. Stem width differences may be noticeable because hinting is turned off.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint.ClearTypeGridFit
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph ClearType bitmap with hinting. The highest quality setting. Used to take advantage of ClearType font features.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.Metered
member.summary: Provides methods to set metered key.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to set metered public and private key
[C#]
Metered metered = new Metered(); metered.SetMeteredKey("PublicKey", "PrivateKey");
[Visual Basic]
Dim metered As Metered = New Metered metered.SetMeteredKey("PublicKey", "PrivateKey")

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.Metered.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.Metered.SetMeteredKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets metered public and private key. If you purchase metered license, when start application, this API should be called, normally, this is enough. However, if always fail to upload consumption data and exceed 24 hours, the license will be set to evaluation status, to avoid such case, you should regularly check the license status, if it is evaluation status, call this API again.

member.summary: Gets consumption file size

member.summary: Gets consumption credit

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.SaveOptions.JpegQualityLevel
member.summary: The Quality category specifies the level of compression for an image. Available values are 0 to 100. The lower the number specified, the higher the compression and therefore the lower the quality of the image. 0 value results in lowest quality image, while 100 results in highest.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.Presentation.Pdf.PdfSaveOptions.OutlineTreeHeight
member.summary: Specifies the height of the document outline tree to save. 0 - the outline tree will not be converted, 1 - only the first level outline items will be converted, ans so on. Default is 10.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.Presentation.Pdf.PdfSaveOptions.OutlineTreeExpansionLevel
member.summary: Specifies up to what level the document outline should be expanded when the PDF file is opened in a viewer. 1 - only the first level outline items are shown, 2 - only the first and second level outline items are shown, and so on. Default is 1.

member.summary: Contains details for a pdf encryption.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.XPS.Presentation.Pdf.PdfEncryptionDetails.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Aspose.Page.XPS.Presentation.Pdf.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.Presentation.Pdf.PdfEncryptionDetails.UserPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets the User password.
member.remarks: Opening the document with the correct user password (or opening a document that does not have a user password) allows additional operations to be performed according to the user access permissions specified in the document’s encryption dictionary.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.Presentation.Pdf.PdfEncryptionDetails.OwnerPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets the Owner password.
member.remarks: Opening the document with the correct owner password (assuming it is not the same as the user password) allows full (owner) access to the document. This unlimited access includes the ability to change the document’s passwords and access permissions.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.Presentation.Pdf.PdfEncryptionDetails.Permissions
member.summary: Gets or sets the permissions.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.Presentation.Pdf.PdfEncryptionDetails.EncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets the encryption mode.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.Presentation.Pdf.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Encryption mode enum. Describe using algorithm and key length. This enum is extended in order to be able to further increase functionality. This enum implements "Base-to-Core" pattern.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.Presentation.Pdf.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm.RC4_40
member.summary: Algorithm, with an RC4 encryption key length of 40 bits;

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.Presentation.Pdf.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm.RC4_128
member.summary: Algorithm, with an RC4 encryption key length of 128 bits and advanced permission set;

member.summary: Describes the front (beginning) cover sheet. Each document will have a separate sheet. The cover sheet should be printed on the and used for the first page of the document. member.summary: Describes the feature options.

member.summary: Specifies no cover will be output.

member.summary: Specifies the cover indicated by "CoverFrontSource" should be printed on the back side of the cover sheet. If a element is not specified, this Option should be ignored.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.DocumentCoverFront.CoverFrontOption.PrintBoth
member.summary: Specifies the cover indicated by "CoverFrontSource" may be printed on either side of the cover sheet. If a element is not specified, this Option should be ignored.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.DocumentCoverFront.CoverFrontOption.PrintFront
member.summary: Specifies the cover indicated by "CoverFrontSource" should be printed on the front side of the cover sheet. If a element is not specified, this Option should be ignored.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.DocumentPageRanges
member.summary: Describes the output range of the document in pages. The parameter value must conform to the following structure: - PageRangeText: "PageRange" or "PageRange,PageRange" - PageRange: "PageNumber" or "PageNumber-PageNumber" - PageNumber: 1 to N, where N is the number of pages in the document.If PageNumber > N, then PageNumber = N. Whitespace in the string should be ignored. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/printdocs/documentpageranges

member.summary: Print the job regardless of the validity of the digital signatures. Digital signatures MAY be ignored.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.JobDigitalSignatureProcessing.JobDigitalSignatureProcessingOption.PrintInvalidSignaturesWithErrorReport
member.summary: Print the job regardless of the validity of the digital signatures. In the event an invalid signature is encountered, an error page should print at the end of the job. Digital signatures MUST not be ignored.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.JobDigitalSignatureProcessing.JobDigitalSignatureProcessingOption.PrintOnlyValidSignatures
member.summary: Print the job only if all digital signatures are valid. Digital signatures MUST not be ignored.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.JobErrorSheet
member.summary: Describes the error sheet output. The entire job will have a single error sheet. The error sheet should be output on the default and using the default . The error sheet should to be isolated from the remainder of the job. This means that any finishing or processing options (such as JobDuplex, JobStaple, or JobBinding) should not include the error sheet. The error sheet should occur as the final sheet of the job. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/printdocs/joberrorsheet

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.DocumentBannerSheet
member.summary: Describes the banner sheet to be output for a particular document. The banner sheet should be output on the default and using the default . The banner sheet should be also isolated from the remainder of the job. This means that any finishing or processing options (such as , , or ) should not include the banner sheet. The banner sheet may or may not be isolated from the remainder of the job. This means that any job finishing or processing options, may include the document banner sheet. The banner sheet should occur as the first sheet of the document. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/printdocs/documentbannersheet

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.DocumentCollate
member.summary: Describes the collating characteristics of the output. All pages in each individual document are collated. DocumentCollate and JobCollateAlldocuments are mutually exclusive. The behavior and implementation of whether both or only one of these keywords is implemented is left to the driver. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/printdocs/documentcollate

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.DocumentDuplex
member.summary: Describes the duplex characteristics of the output. The duplex feature allows for printing on both sides of the media. Each document is duplexed separately. DocumentDuplex and JobDuplexAllDocumentsContiguously are mutually exclusive. It is up to the driver to determine constraint handling between these keywords. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/printdocs/documentduplex

member.summary: Describes the accounting sheet to be output for the job. The accounting sheet should be output on the default and using the default . The accounting sheet should to be isolated from the remainder of the job. This means that any finishing or processing options (such as JobDuplex, JobStaple, or JobBinding) should not include the accounting sheet. The accounting sheet may occur as the first or last page of the job at the implementer's discretion. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/printdocs/jobaccountingsheet

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.JobAccountingSheet.JobAccountingSheetOption
member.summary: Describes the feature options.

member.summary: Specifies no accounting sheet will be output.

member.summary: Specifies the standard (device defined) accounting sheet should be output.

member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: An array of options specific for the feature.

member.summary: Describes the feature options.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageDeviceColorSpaceUsage
member.summary: In conjunction with the parameter, this parameter defines the rendering behavior for elements presented in a device color space. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/printdocs/pagedevicecolorspaceusage

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageDeviceColorSpaceUsage.PageDeviceColorSpaceUsageOption
member.summary: Describes the feature options.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageDeviceColorSpaceUsage.PageDeviceColorSpaceUsageOption.MatchToDefault
member.summary: If the device determines that the profile specified by the parameter can be used as a device color space profile, all elements using the same profile are treated as already being specified in device color space. All other elements MUST use the profile specified for that element. If the profile cannot be used as a device color space profile, elements using the profile MUST be color managed like any other element using the color profile.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageDeviceColorSpaceUsage.PageDeviceColorSpaceUsageOption.OverrideDeviceDefault
member.summary: If the profile specified by the PageDeviceColorSpaceProfileURI parameter has a number of channels matching the number of primaries of the device, it SHOULD be used instead of the devices internal color management for all elements. Elements using this profile are assumed to be in device color space and will not be color managed further.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageDeviceColorSpaceUsage.#ctor(Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageDeviceColorSpaceUsage.PageDeviceColorSpaceUsageOption[])
member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: An array of options specific for the feature.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageForceFrontSide
member.summary: Forces the output to appear on the front of a media sheet. Relevant to media sheets with different surfaces on each side. In cases where this feature interferes with processing options (such as ), PageForceFrontSide takes precedence for the specific page to which the feature applies.

member.summary: Describes the feature options.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageForceFrontSide.PageForceFrontSideOption.ForceFrontSide
member.summary: Specifies output is restricted to the front side of the sheet.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageForceFrontSide.PageForceFrontSideOption.None

member.summary: Describes the negative setting of the output. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/printdocs/pageoutputquality

member.summary: Defines feature options.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageOutputQuality.PageOutputQualityOption.Automatic
member.summary: Specifies the intent for automatic output (allow the client to automatically choose the best settings).

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageOutputQuality.PageOutputQualityOption.Draft
member.summary: Specifies the intent for draft output (balanced for draft quality text and graphics).

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageOutputQuality.PageOutputQualityOption.Fax
member.summary: Specifies the intent for fax output (balanced for standard fax quality).

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageOutputQuality.PageOutputQualityOption.High
member.summary: Specifies the intent for high quality output (balanced for high quality text and graphics).

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageOutputQuality.PageOutputQualityOption.Normal
member.summary: Specifies the intent for normal output (balanced for good quality text and graphics).

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageOutputQuality.PageOutputQualityOption.Photographic
member.summary: Specifies the intent for photographic output (images should have the highest quality).

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PageOutputQuality.PageOutputQualityOption.Text
member.summary: Specifies the intent for text only output (graphics may output poorly or not at all).

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PagePhotoPrintingIntent
member.summary: Indicates a high-level intent to the driver for population of photo printing settings. These settings deal with the expected output quality a user may specify when printing photos. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/printdocs/pagephotoprintingintent

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PagePhotoPrintingIntent.PagePhotoPrintingIntentOption

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PagePhotoPrintingIntent.PagePhotoPrintingIntentOption.None
member.summary: No Photoprinting Intent (Allows the application to specify no intent resolution. PrintTicket settings should not be altered)

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PagePhotoPrintingIntent.PagePhotoPrintingIntentOption.PhotoBest
member.summary: Best Quality Photoprinting (Provided mostly for marketing reasons; utilizes the highest capabilities of the device)

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PagePhotoPrintingIntent.PagePhotoPrintingIntentOption.PhotoDraft
member.summary: Draft Quality Photoprinting (Quick, low ink volume print for proofing purposes)

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.PagePhotoPrintingIntent.PagePhotoPrintingIntentOption.PhotoStandard
member.summary: Standard Quality Photoprinting (OEM suggested settings for standard photo-printing)

member.summary: Describes the watermark setting of the output and the watermark characteristics. Watermarks apply to the logical page, not the physical page. member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsMetadata.JobDuplexAllDocumentsContiguously
member.summary: Describes the duplex characteristics of the output. The duplex feature allows for printing on both sides of the media. All Documents in the job are duplexed together contiguously. and are mutually exclusive. It is up to the driver to determine constraint handling between these keywords. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/printdocs/jobduplexalldocumentscontiguously

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsFillRule
member.summary: Valid values of PathGeometry element's FillRule property.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsFillRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: This rule determines the “insideness” of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from the point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of segments from the given shape that the ray crosses. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if it is even, the point is outside.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsFillRule.NonZero
member.summary: This rule determines the “insideness” of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from the point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray. Starting with a count of zero, add one each time a segment crosses the ray from left to right and subtract one each time a path segment crosses the ray from right to left. After counting the crossings, if the result is zero then the point is outside the path; otherwise, it is inside.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsSweepDirection
member.summary: Valid values of ArcSegment element's SweepDirection property.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsSweepDirection.Counterclockwise
member.summary: Counterclockwise direction.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsSweepDirection.Clockwise
member.summary: Clockwise direction.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsTileMode
member.summary: Valid values of tiling brushes' TileMode property.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsTileMode.None
member.summary: In this mode, only the single base tile is drawn. The remaining area is left transparent.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsTileMode.Tile
member.summary: In this mode, the base tile is drawn and the remaining area is filled by repeating the base tile such that the right edge of each tile abuts the left edge of the next, and the bottom edge of each tile abuts the top edge of the next.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsTileMode.FlipX
member.summary: The tile arrangement is similar to the Tile tile mode, but alternate columns of tiles are flipped horizontally. The base tile is positioned as specified by the viewport. Tiles in the columns to the left and right of this tile are flipped horizontally.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsTileMode.FlipY
member.summary: The tile arrangement is similar to the Tile tile mode, but alternate rows of tiles are flipped vertically. The base tile is positioned as specified by the viewport. Rows above and below are flipped vertically.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsTileMode.FlipXY
member.summary: The tile arrangement is similar to the Tile tile mode, but alternate columns of tiles are flipped horizontally and alternate rows of tiles are flipped vertically. The base tile is positioned as specified by the viewport.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsColorInterpolationMode
member.summary: Valid values of gradient brushes' ColorInterpolationMode property.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsColorInterpolationMode.SRgbLinearInterpolation
member.summary: SRgbLinearInterpolation mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsColorInterpolationMode.ScRgbLinearInterpolation
member.summary: ScRgbLinearInterpolation mode.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsSpreadMethod
member.summary: Valid values of gradient brushes' SpreadMethod property.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsSpreadMethod.Pad
member.summary: In this method, the first color and the last color are used to fill the remaining fill area at the beginning and end.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsSpreadMethod.Reflect
member.summary: In this method, the gradient stops are replayed in reverse order repeatedly to cover the fill area.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsSpreadMethod.Repeat
member.summary: In this method, the gradient stops are repeated in order until the fill area is covered.

member.name: F:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsEdgeMode.Aliased
member.summary: The edges are to be aliased.

member.name: T:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsGlyphs
member.summary: Class incapsulating Glyphs element features. This element represents a run of uniformly-formatted text from a single font. It provides information necessary for accurate rendering and supports search and selection features in viewing consumers.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsGlyphs.BidiLevel
member.summary: Returns/sets the value specifying the Unicode algorithm bidirectional nesting level. Even values imply left-to-right layout, odd values imply right-to-left layout. Right-to-left layout places the run origin at the right side of the first glyph, with positive advance widths (representing advances to the left) placing subsequent glyphs to the left of the previous glyph.

member.summary: Returns/sets the brush used to fill the shape of the rendered glyphs.

member.summary: Returns font resource for the TrueType font used to typeset elements text.

member.summary: Returns/sets the font size in drawing surface units, expressed as a float in units of the effective coordinate space.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsGlyphs.OriginX
member.summary: Returns/sets the x coordinate of the first glyph in the run, in units of the effective coordinate space.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsGlyphs.OriginY
member.summary: Returns/sets the y coordinate of the first glyph in the run, in units of the effective coordinate space.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsGlyphs.IsSideways
member.summary: Returns/sets the value indicating that a glyph is turned on its side, with the origin being defined as the top center of the unturned glyph.

member.summary: Returns/sets the string of text rendered by the Glyphs element. The text is specified as Unicode code points.

member.summary: Returns/sets the array specifying the length of dashes and gaps of the outline stroke.

member.summary: Returns/sets the value specifying how the ends of each dash are drawn.

member.summary: Returns/sets the start point for repeating the dash array pattern. If this value is omitted, the dash array aligns with the origin of the stroke.

member.summary: Returns/sets the value defining the shape of the beginning of the first dash in a stroke.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsPath.StrokeLineJoin
member.summary: Returns/sets the value defining the shape of the beginning of the first dash in a stroke.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsPath.StrokeMiterLimit
member.summary: Returns/sets the ratio between the maximum miter length and half of the stroke thickness. This value is significant only if the StrokeLineJoin attribute specifies Miter.

member.name: P:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsPath.StrokeThickness
member.summary: Returns/sets the thickness of a stroke, in units of the effective coordinate space (includes the path's render transform). The stroke is drawn on top of the boundary of the geometry specified by the Path element’s Data property. Half of the StrokeThickness extends outside of the geometry specified by the Data property and the other half extends inside of the geometry.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsDocument.CreatePathFigure(System.Drawing.PointF,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new path figure.
member.param: The starting point for the first segment of the path figure.

Specifies whether the path is closed. If set to true, the stroke is drawn "closed", that is, the last point in the last segment of the path figure is connected with the point specified in the StartPoint attribute, otherwise the stroke is drawn "open", and the last point is not connected to the start point. Only applicable if the path figure is used in a Path element that specifies a stroke.

member.name: M:Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsDocument.CreatePathFigure(System.Drawing.PointF,System.Collections.Generic.List{Aspose.Page.XPS.XpsModel.XpsPathSegment},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new path figure.
member.param: The starting point for the first segment of the path figure.

Specifies whether the path is closed. If set to true, the stroke is drawn "closed", that is, the last point in the last segment of the path figure is connected with the point specified in the StartPoint attribute, otherwise the stroke is drawn "open", and the last point is not connected to the start point. Only applicable if the path figure is used in a Path element that specifies a stroke.
